oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Various excerpts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpts of live radio performances by Lew Childre, Bill Monroe and The Bluegrass Boys, Milton Estes, Clyde and Marie Dilleha, Pee Wee King and His Golden West Cowboys, George W. Wilkinson and His Fruit Jar Drinkers, and Cowboy Copas, recorded from a broadcast of WSM's Grand Ole Opry (Nashville, Tenn.) with emcees Grant Turner, George D. Hay, and Louis Buck.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Milton Estes; Bill Monroe and The Bluegrass Boys; Pee Wee King and His Golden West Cowboys; George W. Wilkinson and His Fruit Jar Drinkers; Cowboy Copas
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: My Grandfather's Clock (Milton Estes) (incomplete) -- George D. Hay talks and introduces Bill Monroe and The Bluegrass Boys -- Tennessee Blues (Bill Monroe and The Bluegrass Boys) -- George D. Hay talks -- Warren Paint advertisement (Milton Estes) -- Lew Childre talks and advertises Warren Paint -- Grant Turner talks -- Grant Turner introduces David Cobb -- David Cobb advertises Oxydol -- Ernie Keller advertises Royal Crown Cola -- Ernie Keller talks and introduces Louis Buck -- Louis Buck talks and introduces Pee Wee King and His Golden West Cowboys -- Orange Blossom Special (Pee Wee King and His Golden West Cowboys) -- Louis Buck talks and introduces George W. Wilkinson and His Fruit Jar Drinkers -- Tennessee Wagoner (George W. Wilkinson and His Fruit Jar Drinkers) -- Louis Buck talks and introduces Cowboy Copas -- Filipino Baby (Cowboy Copas)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Turner, Grant; Estes, Milton, 1914-1963; Dilleha, Laura Marie Stacey, 1921-2002; Cobb, David (Announcer); Keller, Ernie; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Wilkinson, George; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group)
